United States House Joint Resolution 69 (115th Congress)
PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL DISAPPROVAL OF FINAL RULE OF DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL DISAPPROVAL OF FINAL RULE OF DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 28

congVote.result: So the joint resolution was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the D176final rule of the Department of the Interior relating to ``Non-Subsistence Take of Wildlife, and Public Participation and Closure Procedures, on National Wildlife Refuges in Alaska''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.J. Res. 69, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule of the Department of the Interior relating to ``Non-Subsistence Take of Wildlife, and Public Participation and Closure Procedures, on National Wildlife Refuges in Alaska'', by a yea-and-nay vote of 225 yeas to 193 nays, Roll No. 98.

titleInfo.title: United States House Joint Resolution 69 (115th Congress)
United States House Joint Resolution 69 (115th Congress)
PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL DISAPPROVAL OF FINAL RULE BY SECRETARY OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL DISAPPROVAL OF FINAL RULE BY SECRETARY OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 28

congVote.result: So the joint resolution was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule submitted by Secretary of Health and Human Services relating to compliance with title X requirements by project recipients in selecting subrecipients
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.J. Res. 43, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule submitted by Secretary of Health and Human Services relating to compliance with title X requirements by project recipients in selecting subrecipients, by a recorded vote of 230 ayes to 188 noes, Roll No. 99.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate confirmed the following nominations:<P/>By 51 yeas to 49 nays (Vote No. EX. 68), Mick Mulvaney, of South Carolina, to be Director of the Office of Management and Budget.<P/>Routine lists in the Army, and Navy.<P/>By 52 yeas to 46 nays (Vote No. EX. 71), Scott Pruitt, of Oklahoma, to be Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency.<P/>During consideration of this nomination today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 54 yeas to 46 nays (Vote No. 69), Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the nomination.
